Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • interactr.cs.kuleuven.be.ui.command.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbortEditingCommand, ActivateFocusCommand, AddMessageCommand, AddPartyCommand, AppendCharCommand, CreateDialogCommand, DeleteCommand, DuplicateDiagramCommand, FocusNextCommand, GoDownCommand, GoUpCommand, MovePartyCommand, RemoveLastCharCommand, SelectCommand, SwitchPartyCommand

    public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of commands, representing requests that can be executed or undone. This is a 'Visitor' in the 'Visitor' pattern. Each subclass does not need to

      • execute

        public void execute​(CommandHandler receiver)
             throws CommandNotProcessedException
        Execute this command with the given receiver.
        Parameters:
        receiver - The receiver for which the command should be executed.
        Throws:
        CommandNotProcessedException - If the command could not be executed.

      • executeDiagramWindow

        public void executeDiagramWindow​(DiagramWindow window)
        Execute this command in the given subwindow.
        Parameters:
        window - The diagram window in which the command should be executed.
        Throws:
        CommandNotProcessedException - the command could not be executed by the given receiver.

      • executeDiagramView

        public void executeDiagramView​(DiagramView view)
        Execute this command in the given diagram view.
        Parameters:
        view - The view in which the command should be executed.
        Throws:
        CommandNotProcessedException - the command could not be executed by the given receiver.

      • executeDialogWindow

        public void executeDialogWindow​(DialogWindow dialog)
        Execute this command in the given dialog window.
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog window in which the command should be executed.
        Throws:
        CommandNotProcessedException - the command could not be executed by the given receiver.

      • undo

        public final void undo​()
                throws CommandNotProcessedException
        Undo this command.
        Throws:
        CommandNotProcessedException - The command could not be undone.
